responses.topic: Future of Work and Slack Integration
responses.content: With the combination of Slack and Salesforce, we're redefining the future of work. Slack is not just a collaboration tool; it's becoming the central nervous system for customer engagement, integrating seamlessly with our Customer 360 platform to enhance productivity and customer relationships.
Our intention is to help our customers connect with their customers in new ways. We want to be the number one CRM, the number one in analytics, and remain tightly focused...

We've made changes at Salesforce that we are advising our clients to make, how to get their employees to participate. We have 54,000 employees. For us to achieve these results, everybody has to be on the field and playing the game. We have to also give them the incentive to play, to train them, to keep them motivated...

This is the result of now four amazing quarters of this financial model emerging. And I think we're going to see that continue to pay out for the rest of the year and future years as well that we will benefit from this. It's a commitment that we have to a new model and a new approach and also this idea that it's a new way to work.

responses.topic: Future of Work and Digital Transformation
responses.content: It's a great question. When you look at the trends of this past year like that wonderful Honeywell story that Marc mentioned in his script, they shifted 7,000 salespeople from in-person to virtual customer meetings. Customer meetings aren't going back to conference rooms only. They're going to stay on Zoom as companies like ours just realize that we can execute as well as ever before in this digital environment...

I think one of the things – if you see the numbers, the strength is really across the portfolio. When we talk about the fact that of the seven-figure deals, they on average included more than four of our clouds; we're not selling individual products. We're selling a Customer 360 solution to really transform the entire customer experience...

responses.topic: Customer Data Platform (CDP) and Marketing Cloud
responses.content: Our Customer Data Platform, branded as Customer 360 Audiences, is powered by Hyperforce architecture. It enables scalable, real-time data integration and provides marketers with deep insights to drive personalized campaigns. In Q4, CDP significantly boosted Marketing Cloud performance, driving higher engagement and conversion rates.

Our philosophy is very similar to our philosophy with MuleSoft and Tableau, which is, number one, starting with our mutual customers and how we can help them benefit from the combination of these two technologies. Slack is really the system of engagement for every employee, partner, and customer interaction...

amy_weaver.role: President, Chief Financial Officer & Member of the Executive Committee

responses.topic: Balance Between Growth and Margin Expansion
responses.content: When I look at the balance between growth and profitability, I want to be clear that growth remains our number one priority. Investing into growth, especially in this demand environment, is simply the best thing we can do for the company. That said, I am a big believer that a focus on discipline makes for a stronger and more durable company...

We raised our full-year operating margin improvement guide by 50 basis points, from 17.5% to 18%. This improvement comes from a combination of our strong quarterly performance, T&E savings due to the digital work environment, and renewed focus on operational efficiencies and discipline across the company.

The lowest hanging fruit is clearly our difference in how we are working right now. It's this all-digital work from anywhere. Probably the easiest part on that is the difference in T&E. That clearly has gone way down. We are assuming, for purposes of guidance, some modest return of travel in the second half of this year. But it will be nowhere near where we were pre-pandemic...

The pipeline is very strong, and we saw that build throughout the year, and coming into Q4 we continued to see it build. And that's in spite of having no face-to-face events during the year. It's all been done digitally...

CEOs and C-suite executives are prioritizing digital transformation more than ever. Video allows us to get to decision-makers faster and more frequently, which strengthens our pipeline and positions us well to meet growing demand...

Our agility allows us to maintain the grip of a small company while managing to grow into a 21-plus billion dollar company. This has been crucial in responding to changing customer needs and delivering transformation solutions...

responses.topic: Deal Complexity and Time to Value
responses.content: Deal complexity has increased, with more sophisticated and multi-cloud solutions being demanded by customers. Time to value is now a top priority, and we're ensuring that our solutions are deployed quickly and effectively to meet these needs...

The pipeline is very strong and continues to build despite the shift to digital engagement. We're investing in our sales force to capture the growing demand and are confident in our ability to meet future opportunities...

questions: Can you talk about what you’re working on that would give you the right balance between growth and margin expansion? And as you look at the future of work, what is the position for salesforce.com, and how is Salesforce positioned to take advantage of what you believe to be the future of work and whatever that is, the way we work in the future?

Salesforce has by far the broadest portfolio of different cloud applications today. I was hoping you could parse out what customers are asking for, what cloud application could see the highest uptick in interest as you look at the pipeline. You mentioned Tableau being a meaningful part of the large deal pipeline. But would love to just better understand what cloud applications specifically are revving the most here in this kind of post-vaccine era that we're entering?
How strong is the demand right now versus the past recoveries you've seen? And your best guess, looking on a global basis, how long it lasts?

We were impressed when you sort of stuck it with 17.5% operating margins with the initial FY 2022 guide. Now you're raising it another 50 basis points. Can you talk to us about – does that come from sort of expenses being pushed out? Or is there actual kind of more efficiencies that you're finding in the business that enable you to raise the operating margin guide here?

How do you think about the potential for acceleration coming out of a recession? Does your current pipeline look like it can support it? And are you properly staffed up to capture the opportunity ahead?

How has the complexity of your deals with customers changed over the past year, particularly as it relates to things like deal cycles, deal size, multiproduct adoption, and perhaps customer focus on time to value? How are you adjusting to address those changes?

With your portfolio of clouds engaging customers, offering workspaces for employees, and enabling business introspection with Tableau and Einstein, how do you see Salesforce enabling humans to focus on more meaningful and value-add work in the future of work?
